commits.message:
Changed tagging policy in CloudFormation such that "system tags" (i.e. aws:cloudformation:stack-name, aws:cloudformation:stack-id, aws:cloudformation:logical-id)
are added to resources as the account admin, and user tags are added as the cloudformation stack creator (if they exist).  This allows stacks not to fail
creation in the case that IAM policy does not allow tagging for the creating user, and there are no user tags to add.

This addresses 3 bugs:
EUCA-10264 [Tagging issues addressed with Buckets.  In this case, non-admin user is used for all tags if user tags exist, admin otherwise]
EUCA-10258 [Taggins issues addressed with EC2 items.  In this case, admin user is used for system tags, non-admin user for user tags if they exist]
EUCA-10257 [Same as EUCA-10258]

Also, unreported issues may include AutoScaling groups, which has changed to use the CreateOrUpdateTags() method to add tags after the group is created,
system tags by the admin, user tags by the user (if they exist)
